title: Government Finance Stat.; key figures
maintainer_displayname: ZBO | Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
name: government-finance-stat-key-figures
notes:
This table contains information on the finances of the general government sector. The terms and definitions used are in accordance with the framework of the national accounts. The national accounts are based on the international definitions of the European System of Accounts (ESA 2010). In some cases the terms from the national accounts are replaced by everyday descriptions of revenue and expenditure transactions. In these cases the corresponding term from the national accounts is given in the explanation.

Data available from:
Yearly figures from 1995, quarterly figures from 1999.

Status of the figures:
The figures for the years 2013 and 2014 are provisional. The figures for 2012 are revised provisional. The figures for 2011 are final.

All national accounts figures for 1995-2010 are provisional. This is because the revision of the national accounts has not been completed for the years before 2011. The revision, among other things, is needed to incorporate the European System of Accounts 2010.

Changes as of 26 March 2015:
Provisionale figures for the fourth quarter and the year 2014 have been added. Due to new information, the figures of the first three quarters of 2014 might be altered.
In 2014, Statistics the Netherlands has conducted a major revision on their macro economic data. The National accounts have been compiled in accordance with the guidelines and concepts of the new European System of Accounts 2010 (ESA 2010). In addition, new statistical sources and estimation methods have been used during the revision. This table shows the figures after revision.

When will new figures be published?
New quarterly figures are published three months after the quarter under review. Figures for the first three quarters of a given year are revised when figures for the fourth quarter of the year are published. 
Yearly figures are published for the first time three months after the end of the year concerned. Yearly figures are revised three times: 6, 18 and 30 months after the end of the year. Revised yearly figures are published in June each year.  Quarterly figures are aligned to the three revised years at the end of June.
